health_insurance_schemes.title: New Health Insurance Scheme (NHIS) for Government Employees and Pensioners
health_insurance_schemes.description: The Tamil Nadu government offers the NHIS to its employees and pensioners, providing coverage for specified medical treatments in approved hospitals. The scheme is periodically updated to enhance benefits.

health_insurance_schemes.title: Innuyir Kappom - Nammai Kakkum 48
health_insurance_schemes.description: Launched by the Tamil Nadu government, this scheme provides free emergency care for road accident victims during the first 48 hours post-accident. It covers both residents and non-residents involved in accidents within the state.

health_insurance_schemes.title: Private Health Insurance Plans
health_insurance_schemes.description: Various private insurers offer health insurance plans in Tamil Nadu, including individual, family, senior citizen, critical illness, and super top-up plans. These plans can be tailored to meet specific needs and budgets.

health_insurance_schemes.title: Employees' State Insurance Scheme (ESIS)
health_insurance_schemes.description: A central government initiative, ESIS provides medical care and cash benefits to employees earning up to ₹21,000 per month in ESI-covered units. Benefits include medical treatment, sickness and maternity benefits, and dependents' benefits in case of employment-related death or disablement.

health_insurance_schemes.title: Chief Minister's Comprehensive Health Insurance Scheme (CMCHIS)
health_insurance_schemes.description: A state government scheme offering cashless hospitalization for specific ailments with coverage up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year on a floater basis. It aims to provide quality medical care to vulnerable sections of society.
